headers.subject: Re: dia nazi?
headers.x-spam-status: No, score=-2.3 required=6.0 tests=AWL,BAYES_00 autolearn=ham version=3.1.9
headers.x-authentication-warning: shasta.cs.uiuc.edu: lrclause set sender to lrclause@cs.uiuc.edu using -f
headers.list-id: discussions about usage and development of dia <dia-list.gnome.org>

quote.quotepara: Trying to make my multiplicities visible in dia appears to make my zigalines self arrange into swasticas ....

body.para: If you went from 0.91 or less to the 0.92+ sources, you're seeing the automatic zigzagline layout. Given the right arrangement of objects, they could indeed form swastikas (though I prefer to think of them as sun symbols). That's the danger of zigzaglines.
It's not a question of whether you're paranoid or not, but whether you're paranoid enough:)
body.footer: -- Lars Clausen (http://shasta.cs.uiuc.edu/~lrclause)| HÃ¥rdgrim of Numenor "I do not agree with a word that you say, but I |---------------------------- will defend to the death your right to say it." | Where are we going, and --Evelyn Beatrice Hall paraphrasing Voltaire | what's with the handbasket?
